bow: what an appropriate age to go trick or treating my son will be 14 months at halloween love halloween so naturally super excited to dress him up and go trick or treating my husband thinks he too young and neighbours will think it weird or we re only collecting for ourselves granted my son has cmpi so neither of us can have dairy so my husband the one who will eat most of the candy do what you want was so excited to dress my kids up and show them off we trick or treated for their first halloweens we ate few pieces of candy but gave the rest out to other kids imo 14months is plenty old enough to enjoy walk around the neighborhood to take in all the spooky sights love halloween think anything after months is ok my main concern would be noisy streets and those costumes can get hot to be honest my son was months old when we took him also sure your neighbors will be happy to see baby trick or treating they don care who eats the candy we took my son at months old he was super excited to see all the decorations and lights around the neighbourhood that totally fine just follow his lead if he not enjoying it stop remember when my son was about one and half figured we only do few houses since he was so little but he loved it so much that we did almost the whole neighborhood mu daughter will be 14 month too at halloween we ll go trick or treating with friend with an older kid but no sure we ll actually collet candy just want to dress her up hehe mine is 15 months old we are going to dress up as cats and dogs as family and take some pictures visit her grandparents and few of our friends who also have little kids before they go trick or treating am going to keep her home otherwise this year though those who are going have fun love halloween at 18m we took dd1 around to nearby family members houses to show off the cuteness and visit briefly wish the answer for this was any age because as an adult still love random candy lol we went with my son cousin when he was 14 months and she was 20 it was super cute say do it we only ended up doing about one block because they got tired fast but we got some great pictures go trick or treating with cute baby eat cute baby candy there is no wrong answer here we ll go when our oldest is or if we go now he ll have no idea what going on and try to run off my daughter was months old on her first halloween dressed her up as little lamb and took her out it was fun for me of course and she liked seeing other kids costumes think you should take him and have fun it not weird as long as he having fun neighbors who are giving out candy on halloween want to see cute kids in costumes if you feel uncomfortable about collecting candy just decline go trick or treating and collect some canned goods for the food bank we ve had lots of one year olds com to our door over the years my daughter wore costume when she was less than year old she did not know the entire holiday that she was part of but she knew she had fun outfit played with some kids and got some candy while my heart melted looking how cute she was everyone won even though she was only partially aware of what was going on when my son was that age on halloween we went to couple of neighbor houses trick or treating but he mostly loved handing out candy at home had the same concern with my son at the same age he has cousin about year older so we tagged along with him and his mom for trick or treating it was fun and no one seemed to judge his age my daughter was 15 months our first time out and we took her down one street that was about it the adults all commented positive things and did act like we were just there for candy for ourselves we also took her to nursing home in the afternoon for an indoor trick or treating event they did that was blast it was very slow paced event which worked well for us all the residents loved each kid that came by we ve done that each year since it makes us so happy this year we re going to do quick walk around our street with our son who will be months on halloween we will show him off but request no candy we re basically just introducing him to our neighbours that we do talk to so they know him and to look out for him and all and we ll then head back home to distribute candy and eat some of it in between trick or treaters have totally had parents with very young kids trick or treat with candy pail before and have never judged them for it figure they just want nice memories of their kid first halloween and they re excited for what to come in year or two months that one point for my husband team then he
